result.execSummary:
The defendant Luis Alejandro Torres-Robles was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

supervisions.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Court imposed mandatory DNA surcharge  and all applicable costs, surcharges and assessments.  To be collected by DOC from 25% of prison funds and to convert to civil judgment upon release from Extended supervision.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count three.

Mental health assessment.  Comply with recommended treatment.
No drugs, contact with drug community, E.A.  No contact with Kathiria V. without agent's consent.

Cognitive behavior therapy.
Anger management.
Domestic violence program.
Pay supervision fees.
Alcohol and drug assessment.  Comply with recommended treatment.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms and body armor and that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count two. Credit for 131 days.

records.addlTxt: denied, signed and filed
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Wagner, Br. 38, calendar successor, for review. mag
Count two.
Original Sentencing Hearing Transcript (22 pages) commencing May 28, 2014 received and filed.
Count two.
Count three.

Defendant Luis Alejandro Torres-Robles in court with attorney Robert L Taylor.  Defendant Luis Alejandro Torres-Robles in custody.  Jennifer L Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Presentence Investigation reviewed.  Additions and corrections not made.  Statements by state, defense and defendant. 
AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 7 YEARS concurrent with count 3, with credit for 131 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 4 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.  Conditions of extended supervision:
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with recommended treatment.
*Mental health assesment  and comply with recommended treatment.
*Random urine screens.
*No drugs.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with EA.
*No contact with Kathiria V. without agent's consent
*Seek and maintain fulltime employment
*Obtain high school diploma or GED
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy
*Vocational/educational training
*Parenting classes
*Anger Management
*Domestic Violence program
*Pay supervision fees.

Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample and imposed mandatory surchages and imposed all applicable costs and surcharges.

AS TO COUNT 3:
The court ordered defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction, concurrent with count 2, with credit for 131days time served.  

Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharge and mandatory DNA surcharge.

The Court ordered the defendant to pay DNA surcharge and all other applicable costs and any other surcharges and assessments to be collected by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds and to convert to civil judgment upon release from extended supervision.  

Court informs defendant he is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program or Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms and body armor and that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into to the custody of the MIlwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Filed,
- Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
- Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
jad

Attorney Robert L Taylor in court, defendant Luis Alejandro Torres-Robles not in court, in custody.  Jennifer L Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Williams in trial in another court.  Case adjourned for sentencing hearing in Branch 10.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.

On motion of the State, Court ordered presentence investigation. Order for presentence investigation filed; copy to Probation Dept.  
Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 10.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms/body armor.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Luis Alejandro Torres-Robles in court with attorney Robert L. Taylor.  Defendant Luis Alejandro Torres-Robles in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 4:
State's motion to dismiss and read-in courts 1 and 4 granted by the court.
AS TO COUNT 3:
State's motion to dismiss penalty enhancer in count 3 granted by the court.
AS TO COUNTS 3 AND 4:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Robert L. Taylor in court, defendant Luis Alejandro Torres-Robles not in court, in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 10.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.
State Subpoena

State's Motions in Limine filed with:
-State's Witness List.
jad

Attorney Robert L Taylor in court, defendant Luis Alejandro Torres-Robles not in court, in custody.  Jennifer L. Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case is adjourned for final pretrial conference and for jury trial in Branch 10.
Filed, signed Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for April 14, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Robert L Taylor in court, defendant Luis Alejandro Torres-Robles not in court, in custody.  No appearance by the State.
Case adjourned for scheduling conference in Branch 10.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Luis Alejandro Torres-Robles in court with attorney Robert L Taylor.  Defendant Luis Alejandro Torres-Robles in custody.  Miriam Falk appeared for Jennifer Williams for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding prior convictions that are attached to the complaint.  Sworn for the state:  Milwaukee Police Detective Tammy Tramel-McClain.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dugan, Branch 10.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference.  Scheduling conference scheduled for 02-07-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with EA (6/11/05), IVETTE J. AND KATHIRIA VJ OR THEIR FAMILY/RESIDENCE/WORKPLACE/SCHOOL
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Luis Alejandro Torres-Robles in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  Defendant Luis Alejandro Torres-Robles in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant pled not guilty TO MISDEMEANOR COUNTS 3 & 4.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge DUGAN, Branch 10.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
